submission.title: A Trusted Annotation Layer for Shakespeare's Plays
submission.overview: This submission proposes a web-based annotation layer focused initially on the works of William Shakespeare. For centuries, scholars and readers have annotated Shakespeare’s plays with footnotes and glosses. Yet, most online editions—including high-traffic projects like Open Source Shakespeare—lack accessible footnotes. This effort would establish a collaborative, trusted, and extensible annotation system allowing footnotes and glosses to be layered directly onto public web texts. With a focus on educational value, transparency, and collaborative authorship, this system would begin with Shakespeare but extend to other canonical and public domain texts. This submission was generated with protocol META-DP-EVAL-v1.3.

directly_addressed_dps.summary: Enables distributed annotation and scholarly collaboration through a structured, community-based interface.
Creates an open educational resource that enhances learning, literacy, and contextual understanding of classical texts.
Implements clearly sourced, peer-reviewed annotations and visible version history to ensure reliability.

directly_addressed_dps.dp: DP19 - Amplifying Presence and Community Engagement
directly_addressed_dps.summary: Invites wide participation from educators, students, and literature enthusiasts, fostering cultural engagement and co-creation.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Peer Review and Version Tracking in Annotation Layers
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: The annotation system includes mechanisms for peer review and visible version histories, ensuring transparency in scholarly collaboration.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: Scholarly annotations must be both credible and open to scrutiny; version tracking fosters trust in collaborative contributions.

clarifications_and_extensions.title: Structured Collaboration Across Domains
clarifications_and_extensions.clarification: The platform allows contributors to collaboratively annotate texts in a modular, structured format that supports future extension to other texts and contexts.
clarifications_and_extensions.why_it_matters: This structured collaborative interface lowers barriers to entry and encourages sustained contribution from diverse communities.
